content: Singaporean architectThis article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Denis McSwiney" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(May 2017)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Denis Lesley McSwiney** came to [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) in 1828 and was responsible for the construction of the [Cathedral of the Good Shepherd](/wiki/Cathedral_of_the_Good_Shepherd). Having been a [merchant](/wiki/Merchant) and [contractor](/wiki/Independent_contractor), he was at one time a [clerk](/wiki/Clerk_(position)) to [George Drumgoole Coleman](/wiki/George_Drumgoole_Coleman). Leaving Singapore in 1847, he had only one other building to his credit, the first Assembly Rooms, built on the site of the [old Hill Street Police Station](/wiki/Old_Hill_Street_Police_Station), which became unserviceable in 1858, ten years after its erection. This Singaporean biographical article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Denis McSwiney
